paper_abstract: A non-doped-type structure was proposed for obtaining organic light-emitting devices with high-efficiency and full-spectrum white light emission. The device structure included indium tin oxide glass substrate/450 angstrom 4,4',4"-tris{N-(3-methylphenyl)-N-phenylamin)triphenylamine (m-MTDATA) hole injection layer/ 100 angstrom N,N'-bis-(1-naphthyl)-N,N'-diphenyl- 1,1'-biph-enyl-4,4'-diamine (NPB) hole transport layer/150 angstrom 4,4'-bis(2,2-diphenylvinyl)-1,1'-biphenyl (DPVBi) blue emitting layer/ultrathin [2-methyl-6-[2-(2,3,6,7-tetrahydro-1H, 5H-benzo[ij] quinolizin-9-yl)ethenyl]-4H-pyran-4-ylidene] propane-dinitrile (DCM2) yellow-emitting layer/ 80 A 4,7-diphenyl-1,10-phenanthroline (BPhen) electron transporting layer and hole blocking layer/600 angstrom tris (8-hydroxyquinoline) aluminium (Alq3) electron-transporting layer /10 angstrom lithium fluoride (LiF)/aluminum (Al). A white emission (Commission Internationale de FEclairage 1931 chromaticity coordinate) (X = 0.3556, Y = 0.3117) at 5 V and (X = 0.282, Y = 0.2658) at 15 V was obtained. Its luminance was 11,497 cd/m(2) at 15 V, and the maximum efficiency was 4.8 lm/W at 5 V. (C) 2006 Published by Elsevier B.V.
paper_title: White organic light-emitting devices with non-doped-type structure
